metadata.title: CVE-2021-3551 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low
metadata.description: A flaw was found in the PKI-server, where the spkispawn command, when runin debug mode, stores admin credentials in the installation log file. Thisflaw allows a local attacker to retrieve the file to obtain the adminpassword and gain admin privileges to the Dogtag CA manager. The highestthreat from this vulnerability is to confidentiality.

criterions.comment: dogtag-pki: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
